description: From French girandole, from Italian girandola, from girare (“to turn, gyrate”).

entries.meaning: An ornamental branched candle holder, sometimes with a mirror behind.
examples: As I sat in my usual nook, and looked at him with the light of the girandoles on the mantelpiece beaming full over him...

entries.meaning: (pyrotechnics) A type of firework which creates a "whirling top" or "flying saucer" effect.
